Morning Line for Round 3, A Class, Monday 6/10
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Coliseum (Public Monster Rancher Tournaments): Legend Cup! Archive: Smack-Down Arena (Discussion/Q&A): Morning Line for Round 3, A Class, Monday 6/10
By torey luvullo on Friday, June 7, 2002 - 05:00 am:

...not mepersoner style!

I am really looking forward to this event. None of the monsters is totally outclassed. Here is how I see it.

MonsterBreedTrainerOdds
SunnaApePetit-Trot9-5
FirstGobiMepersoner9-5
ThlayliHareHare Raiser3-1
Cold FireTigerSteel Pixie5-1


There may be some ...er...discussion as to why I list Sunna ahead of First, although the odds show i consider them to be essentially co-favorites. The Ape has the compact tech array which has proven very effective in battle. His spd and def are both better than the Gloomy Golem. I think he is eventually going to land more blows and pull off a narrow victory. However, it would not shock me in the least to see the Gobi emerge the victor. He has more skill and more power than the Funky Monkey, and his hardest hitting techs hit a little harder - if he can access them on the slightly cluttered golem movelist.

I am not counting out either Thlayli or Cold Fire [especially since i took the time to learn how to spell Thlayli!] The Hare has max pow, skill and speed, and has taken the time to learn a couple of the big-time hare techs. 999 speed means a lot of dodging - with luck, enough to win. He better dodge a lot, though, because the 590 lif/366 def combo renders the Hurryin' Hare a tad vulnerable, especially against this high level of competition. The Tiger comes strong with int against a pow field - always gives him a shot at winning every match. However, if the hare is a tad vulnerable, the Ferocious Feline is wide open with 452 lif/40 def...the hare could take a hit and still have a chance; the tiger may go down at first contact. 999 speed better mean "dodge 'em all".
